fields.summary: Remove Spring exclusion in studio-fireball and studio-fisheye

fields.description:
This test should verify if the com.atlassian.studio.fisheye.upgrade.UpgradeTo_v15 ran with success.
But the new admin screen uses GWT and the JWebUnit test isn't working anymore.
fields.summary: Fix test TestFisheyeUpgrades.testAvatarIsSet

fields.description: We won't support automatic conversion to Conf+, so we'll need to exactly document the process including HAMS requirements prior to launch, for support, Ernest, and so we'll know what needs to be automated when we do build it.
fields.summary: document process for upgrading from Confluence On Demand to Confluence + other tools
Merge 3.0 to trunk

fields.description: This can be done once [JRA-23856|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23856] and [JRA-23776|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23776] is done.
fields.summary: Remove trusted apps maintainer hacks

fields.description: Please bundle our supported plugin JIRA Workflow Designer: https://plugins.atlassian.com/plugin/details/10622
fields.summary: Bundle JIRA Workflow Designer

fields.description: Create a new pre-commit hook for people that do pre-commit reviews to ensure that there is a valid review key in the commit message
fields.summary: Crucible pre-commit hook

fields.description:
I came across multiple tickets where the license was gone.
Customer could not browse to the source tab.

When you browse as admin you get to the setup page and need to insert the licenses.
fields.summary: License for Fisheye and Crucible disapears

fields.description:
Even though the initial data setup code isn't run on Zeus, upgrade tasks still need access to the initial data xml file.

Add a target to the {{build.xml}} file in the fireball to generate the initial data xml file.
fields.summary: Change build.xml to create the initial data xml

fields.description:
On {{googledev.jira.com}}, clicking Google bar buttons will bring about some errors. The observations are slightly different across browsers.

+*On Firefox and Chrome*+:

* Clicking the non-Google-specific buttons ("Recent Activity", "Recent Issues", "Favourite Pages", and "Outstanding Reviews") will bring up a small panel with following message:
{noformat}
There was an error retrieving this feed.
{noformat}

* Clicking the Google-specific buttons ("Unread Gmail Messages", "Upcoming Events" and "Recent Google Docs") will bring up a small panel with a spinning icon, but that panel will disappear in less than 1 second by itself.

+*On IE 8*+:

Clicking any button will bring up a small panel with a spinning icon without other contents, and trigger the following JavaScript error:
{noformat}
Webpage error details

User Agent: Mozilla/4.0 (compatible; MSIE 8.0; Windows NT 5.1; Trident/4.0)
Timestamp: Mon, 7 Mar 2011 05:22:57 UTC


Message: Access is denied.

Line: 247
Char: 287
Code: 0
URI: https://googledev.jira.com/s/589/2/3.0.9/_/download/batch/com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs/com.atlassian.auiplugin:ajs.js
{noformat}
fields.summary: Google bar not working on googledev

fields.description:
This is tricky in JIRA, which caches the trusted apps keys and requires a restart of the PICO container.  JIRA request tracked here:

http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-23856
fields.summary: When a Zeus instance is upgraded to Studio with shared keys, it's trusted apps keys need to be updated

fields.description: This makes trusted apps soooo much easier, fixes a lot of bugs, and will be needed before we move to UAL.
fields.summary: Shared trusted apps keys

fields.description: Please see the screenshot [^google-account.png].
fields.summary: Distorted UI in Google account management page

fields.description:
This class needed to be patched on 2.5 because the default System bundle on FECRU 2.5.x doesn't export the package org.hibernate anymore, and the old streams-fisheye-plugin:3.4.5 still has a hard dependency on that some Hibernate classes.
When *Studio upgrades* to Activity Streams 4.x the dependency is gone and it's safe to remove this class as the new implementation on streams-fisheye-plugin doesn't have this dependency.
fields.summary: Remove patched file com.atlassian.fisheye.plugin.FisheyePackageScannerConfiguration

fields.description: This is a real bug, and the application is showing the source and issue tab panels on the browse project page even when FishEye and Crucible are disabled.
fields.summary: Fix failing test TestStudioAlacarte.testBrowseProjectDisplayRelevantTabPanels
SVN Importer doesn't preserve hooks directory and possibly more

fields.description: When implementing FishEyeInitialData, the only way to get a hold of an OsgiContainerManager was to use reflection.  I believe this has to have changed as a result of UAL, because FishEye would need to get a hold of it to get the AppLinks components.  Once we upgrade to a version of FishEye that has UAL, if that code doesn't break anyway, we should remove it to make sure we use the published OsgiContainerManager (it can probably be found in SpringContext).
fields.summary: Remove reflection call to get OsgiContainerMessage

fields.description: Once [FE-2970|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/FE-2970] is implemented, the code in FisheyeDataSetupErrorReporter that uses reflection mode to set maintenance mode indefinitely needs to be removed and replaced with the mechanism provided by FishEye.
fields.summary: Remove hacky reflection call once indefinite maintenance mode is implemented in FishEye

fields.description: The Bamboo initial data code or a Bamboo upgrade task should set up the mail server in the Bamboo admin section.
fields.summary: Bamboo initial data does not setup mail server

fields.description:
On {{googledev.jira.com}}, we get the mixed SSL content warning.

On this instance, SSL was enforced:
# SSL automatic re-direction was configured in Apache
# the URLs in {{studio.default.properties}} were in the form of https.

This is the content of {{studio.default.properties}}:
{noformat}
#
# General studio configuration defaults
#
# The configuration in this file may be overridden by anything in the studio.properties file in the studio home
# directory.
#

# Whether this instance of studio is using an external crowd (disables
# collaborator licensing if true)
studio.external.crowd=false

# The sysadmin user
studio.sysadmin.user=sysadmin

# Whether Bamboo is enabled for this instance
studio.bamboo.enabled=true

# Whether this is a Studio Gapps instance
studio.gapps.enabled=true

# Instance details
studio.instance.hostname=googledev.jira.com
studio.instance.ip=63.246.18.130

crowd.cookie.domain=.googledev.jira.com

# Enforce SSL by default
studio.enforce.ssl=true

# Base URLs to applications
studio.jira.base.url=https://googledev.jira.com
studio.fisheye.base.url=https://googledev.jira.com/source
studio.confluence.base.url=https://googledev.jira.com/wiki
studio.bamboo.base.url=https://googledev.jira.com/builds
studio.svn.base.url=file:///data/jirastudio/svn/root
studio.svn.public.url=https://googledev.jira.com/svn
# Base URLs to Gapps apps
chatbar.base.url=https://googledev.jira.com/chatbar
chatbar.comet.base.url=https://googledev.jira.com/chatbar

# Mail configuration
studio.mail.server=localhost
studio.mail.server.username=admin
studio.mail.server.password=admin
studio.mail.server.from.email.address=jira@googledev.jira.com

# GAPPS Related configuration
com.atlassian.agmp.domain.name=atl-paid-dev.com
com.atlassian.agmp.admin.email=gapps-syd@atlassian.com
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.consumer.key=808816623627.apps.googleusercontent.com
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.signer.url=http://signer/cgi-bin/signer/signer.pl
com.atlassian.agmp.google.logout.url=http://www.google.com/a/atl-paid-dev.com/Logout
com.atlassian.agmp.reprovision=0

# no more than 50 concurrent requests:
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.signer.max.connections=50
# 10 second timeout:
com.atlassian.agmp.oauth.signer.http.timeout.millis=10000
{noformat}

fields.description:
We are doing away with numerical version numbers and studio releases will be tagged by the month of release.

* How does this affect the version in the footer?
* What versions do we use in our source code?
* What do the svn tags look like?
* How \[much] does this affect what the customer knows of the release? Does it change marketing/advertising?
fields.summary: Versioning scheme changes

The current version of Balsamiq that is bundled with JIRA Studio 2.4 is running into the following bug:
http://community.balsamiq.com/balsamiq/topics/null_pointer_exception_when_using_jira_shortcuts_operations_menu

Let's see if we can upgrade Balsamiq to a version that doesn't experience this.

fields.description:
Bamboo 2.6.2 can deadlock when its connection to AWS is lost. This issue is fixed in Bamboo under http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-6430 and/or http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BAM-6310.
Customers encounter this regularly, so it would be great to backport the fixes to Bamboo 2.6.2 for the Studio 2.4.1 release
fields.summary: Bamboo hangs when connection to AWS is lost

fields.description:

fields.description:
On instances with large attachments databases, we're seeing regular OOMEs when Confluence rebuilds its search index. According to [CONF-10512,|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-10512], a block of memory equal to the size of all indexed & stored attachments is requested from the heap during indexing. The workaround is to [set a limit on the portion of attachments that are indexed|http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Configuring+Attachment+Size] using atlassian.indexing.contentbody.maxsize.

We should set this by default to e.g. ~4MB.
fields.summary: Set atlassian.indexing.contentbody.maxsize to avoid OOMEs in Confluence during indexing

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}

fields.description:
Crucible issues a POST request directly to JIRA to create an issue from the comment, then uses a regex to parse the HTML response for the new issue key. The regex used by Crucible 2.2.7 is incompatible with the markup produced by JIRA 4.2.2. Therefore, Crucible assumes the issue creation failed with no error message.

This is fixed in recent levels of FeCru: APL-402 / [CRUC-4440|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CRUC-4440].
fields.summary: Issue creation from Crucible results in an error message and no issue key in the comment (issue is created correctly).

JQL query searching for issues not containing label X ({{NOT labels = X}}) should also return issues with no label.
